caption:
“I don’t want to die at work.”
 
‘Kamikaze’ shoplifting is where an offender openly clears shelves of items in full view of customers and shop workers, no mask, and no fear.
 
Retail crime is ‘out of control’ and shoplifters are not worried about any consequences, an industry body has told the BBC.
 
And one shop worker - who was punched while confronting a suspected thief - told us the last three years had been the worst on record.
 
Top the link in @BBCNews’s bio to hear more from industry leaders.
